definition: master (of the house)/main character in a novel etc/hero or heroine
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
elderly man/father/father-in-law/neck feathers of a bird (old)

sentences.english: As is well known, we students are the future masters of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 如衆所周知，我們學生都是國家未來的主人翁。

sentences.english: Many of Hemingway's heroses love bullfight.
sentences.chinese: 海明威的許多主人翁喜歡鬥牛。

sentences.english: Give full play to the people as masters, to raise the level of community self-government.
sentences.chinese: 充分發揮居民主人翁作用，提高社區自治水平。

sentences.english: Dear students, you master Ireland's future development.
sentences.chinese: 同學們，你們是愛爾蘭未來發展的主人翁。

sentences.english: Many of Hemingway's heroes love bullfight.
sentences.chinese: 海明威的許多主人翁喜歡鬥牛。

sentences.english: Dear students, you also master the future of China Ireland relations.
sentences.chinese: 同學們，你們也是中愛關係健康發展的主人翁。

sentences.english: People's status as masters of society must be respected and their legal rights protected.
sentences.chinese: 尊重人民羣衆的主人翁地位，維護其合法權益。

definition: hero (of a novel or film)/main protagonist
heroine (of a novel or film)/main female protagonist
start of literary work/opening song of ballad in Tanci style 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2]
to talk about/to narrate/to give an account
person/character (in a play, novel etc)/protagonist/CL:個|个[ge4]
